frame.name: Range
frame.definition:
<def-root>There is a certain physical <fen>Distance</fen> within which some other entity can participate in an <fen>Event</fen> (typically perception or manipulation) with the <fen>Participant</fen>. Alternatively, the <fen>Event</fen> may be indicated metonymically by a <fen>Instrument</fen> . [Note the connection with *Distance, Sufficiency, and Capability. Words in this frame can generally be paraphrased "close enough to be able to".]
<ex>I'm sorry, but he was well within the <fex name="eve">blast</fex> <t><fex name="dis">range</fex></t>.</ex> <ex>They are now within <fex name="par">our</fex> <fex name="ins">missile</fex> <t><fex name="dis">range</fex></t>.</ex> <ex>They are now within <fex name="par">our missile 's</fex> <t><fex name="dis">range</fex></t>.</ex> <ex>They are now within <fex name="ins">missile</fex> <t><fex name="dis">range</fex></t>.</ex> <ex>But then they passed out of <fex name="par">my</fex> <t><fex name="dis">earshot</fex></t>. <fex name="ins">INC</fex></ex> <ex>I would consider <fex name="eve">striking</fex> <t>distance</t> to <ment>be</ment> <fex name="dis">about two meters</fex> for this weapon.</ex> <ex>Jordanian troops came within easy <t><fex name="dis">strike</fex></t> of Israel.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>A type of occurrence whose effects extend a certain distance.</def-root>

FE.name: Participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity that is conceived as driving the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex><fex name="par">Their</fex> missile <t>range</t> has decreased, since we have degraded their sensors.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity which is deployable by the <fen>Participant</fen> to interact with things within a certain distance.
<ex>Their <fex name="ins">laser</fex> <t>range</t> is four times ours .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root>The spatial extent over which the <fen>Participant</fen> can interact in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Our <t>range</t> is <fex name="dis">smaller than theirs</fex>.</ex> <ex>Normal people have a <t>reach</t> <fex name="dis">of around one meter</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The conditions under which the description of a <fen>Participant</fen>'s range holds.
<ex>The patient has a lesser <t>range</t> of motion <fex name="cir">in cold weather</fex>.</ex></def-root>
